channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: All you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Canterbury on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Non-essential Victorian retail stores have been directed to shut tonight, as the state returns to remote learning.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria's stage four business restrictions come into effect as state's COVID-19 case surge continues; Australian death toll stands at 232

item.description: Richmond coach Damien Hardwick says his attacking spearhead Tom Lynch has found his mojo but an incident involving Alex Witherden is set to come under scrutiny.
item.title: Hardwick lauds Lynch's aggression, but will tribunal trouble follow?

item.description: Drug trafficker and fuel thief Jose Antonio Yepez, alias "El Marro," or "The Mallet" removes one of the two bosses battling for control of Guanajuato state.
item.title: Mexican drug lord who 'never slept two nights in the same place' arrested

item.description: Fulham have won their second Championship play-off final in three seasons to return to the top flight at the expense of cross-London rivals Brentford.
item.title: Knife of Bryan: Fulham win richest game in sport to return to EPL

item.description: Our support agencies and the community sector are already stretched to their limits. And we are all expecting the number of people needing homes to grow and grow fast.
item.title: Bigger commitment needed on WA public housing as support agencies stretched to their limits

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Australian all-rounder Ash Gardner says the countryâ€™s top women cricketers would be willing to head into a biosecure bubble to ensure their schedule can be completed.
item.title: Top women cricketers willing to head into bubble

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Land sales in Perth have boomed as buyers snap up new lots before government subsidies rolled out during the COVID-19 pandemic end in December.
item.title: Perth land sales boom as home buyers ride the coronavirus subsidy wave

item.description: As President Donald Trump's poll numbers continue to sink, Wall Street is starting to envision what life under Joe Biden would look like. Not everyone likes what they see.
item.title: Wall Street torn on whether a Biden win brings joy or misery

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Victoria's second wave of coronavirus is beginning to seep into states which had eliminated the virus. At least 80 per cent of the incidents could have been avoided if other states adopted WA's hard border closure stance.
item.title: Victoria's second wave has begun seeping into COVID-free states. But could hard borders like WA's have prevented the spread?

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The World Cup winning Wallaby will lead Australia's bid for the 2027 World Cup in the face of some stiff opposition.
item.title: Kearns appointed 2027 Rugby World Cup bid boss

item.description: Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the president, will see his grip on the country tighten if, as expected, his brother Mahinda is elected as prime minister.
item.title: Sri Lankan minorities fear poll victory for Rajapaksa brothers

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to dip at open despite Wall Street gains

item.description: Ireland have chased down an imposing target to stun England with a seven-wicket win in a dead-rubber third ODI in Southampton.
item.title: Stirling gold helps Ireland complete massive chase to shock England

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: In an interview with Australian White House correspondent Jonathan Swan, Donald Trump found himself struggling to explain his version of the facts.
item.title: The stuff of memes: Australian reporter's hard-hitting Trump interview goes viral

item.description: Australia's Adam Scott will also tee off as part of an all-star trio featuring Rickie Fowler and man of the moment Bryson DeChambeau.
item.title: Tiger, McIlroy and Thomas grouped together at PGA Championship

item.description: Wall Street ended higher after a choppy session, lifted by Apple and energy stocks but limited by declines in AIG and Microsoft while investors awaited more US government stimulus.
item.title: Wall Street ends higher as investors eye stimulus

item.description: Richard Branson's Virgin Atlantic filed for Chapter 15 bankruptcy protection in the US and told a London court that it could fold next month unless it secures approval for a Â£1.2 billion rescue package.
item.title: Virgin Atlantic files for bankruptcy in US, warns it is running out of cash as it seeks rescue deal approval

item.description: Rafael Nadal has announced he will not defend his US Open crown as organisers released the singles list of entrants for the New York major.
item.title: Nadal announces he will skip US Open as entries announced

item.description: The storm, which made landfall in North Carolina as a hurricane, has been swiftly moving up the East Coast.
item.title: Isaias batters New York region, leaving 1 million without power

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: Crossbenchers have come out against government plans for a gas-led recovery, citing undue industry influence and worsening greenhouse gas emissions
item.title: Crossbenchers condemn government's plans for a gas-lead recovery

item.description: The proportion of those aged 15 to 24 who are infected with coronavirus has risen three-fold in five months.
item.title: Young people are fuelling a second coronavirus wave, says WHO

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: A 29-year-old man has been charged with another 80 child abuse offences, after his February arrest allegedly uncovered a national online network of at least nine sex offenders.
item.title: Central Coast man charged with a further 80 child sexual abuse offences

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison said one Australian had been killed in the blast and embassy staff were working to determine how many others had been injured.
item.title: Hospitals overwhelmed as explosion rocks Lebanese capital Beirut

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The funding boost from the state government comes on the proviso that councils speed up their development assessments.
item.title: Councils to tap into $250m pool for public spaces

item.description: Premier, ''holding the line'' against a second wave just doesnâ€™t cut it. This virus doesnâ€™t let you hold the line.
item.title: Victoria's fate will be ours without renewed lockdown

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: The arrest and incarceration rates of Aboriginal adults and children have reached the level of a national crisis, says prominent academic Marcia Langton.
item.title: Indigenous arrest rates are a national crisis, says Marcia Langton

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The urban race for space is putting many animal and plant species in danger.
item.title: 'Miracles in our own backyards': Rare urban ecosystems on the brink

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The Rabbitohs haven't waited for Joseph Suaalii to commit before signing two of his 17-year-old teammates to lucrative NRL contracts.
item.title: Young talent time: Souths sign two more teen stars to NRL deals

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: At a time when the NRL is operating under strict biosecurity measures, a lower-grade player has been given a ban of just one week for smearing blood on an opponent.
item.title: Former NRL halfback cops ban for smearing blood on opponent

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: CityCats will stop at Kangaroo Point for the first time because Brisbane's old timber ferries are out of action while they are checked for safety.
item.title: CityCats step in while Kangaroo Point loses its hop

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Employees at News Corp's Sydney bunker received an update this week from management
item.title: Dore hunkers outside News Corp's bunker

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Several local publishers could be ineligible to negotiate with Google and Facebook under a new code of conduct.
item.title: New Daily, sports media could miss out under digital code

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A Singaporean investor has swooped on a two-storey warehouse and showroom in Collingwoodâ€™s Gipps Street.
item.title: Investor pays $13m for Collingwood warehouse

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Working from home has led to a greater reliance on the internet, leading to a surge in the demand for data storage facilities.
item.title: Data centres in hot demand with remote working on the rise

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Internal emails obtained by the Herald show icare queried its own regulator's costs immediately before an investigation was launched.
item.title: Icare queried its own regulator's costs

item.description: Famous â€“ and even notorious â€“ Sydney venues and locations where music and magic were made are now gone without a trace.
item.title: Oz rock's sacred sites fade to black

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Total wine exports for 2019-20 have dropped 1 per cent to $2.84 billion but consumers, especially in China, are buying more expensive Australian wines.
item.title: Wine exports dip for first time in years but China exports hold up

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Investors are directing significant capital into the burgeoning build-to-rent sector, with leading developers offering up more opportunities as they expand their portfolios.
item.title: Capital investors eye the growing build-to-rent sector

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: After decades of cutbacks, coronavirus has shown the need for strong leadership and the crucial role of government in providing services.
item.title: Virus reminder: governments need to be better, not smaller

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Bunnings' landlord said its tenant had a solid business model that would provide rental growth in the coming year.
item.title: Bunnings landlord shows resilience in tough market

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: Politicians and their minders can't help reaching for slogans to help sell their messages. Here's one that makes my blood boil.
item.title: Here's an idea for politicians and their staff: Stop the slogans

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A food importer and wholesaler has snapped up a large office warehouse at a price above $8 million.
item.title: Food importer swoops on office warehouse

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, August 5

item.description: After years of wartime scarcity, cigarettes, nylons and other goods were on offer at the newly reopened David Jones store on Market Street, Sydney.
item.title: From the Archives, 1946: Rush for luxury items as city store re-opens

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Efforts by authorities to clamp down on the Cedar Meats outbreak were hampered by confidentiality requirements.
item.title: Inquiry finds virus tracking hampered by privacy laws

item.description: In 1971, Qantas paid a $500,000 ransom when the mysterious "Mr Brown" threatened to destroy a Boeing 707 jet carrying 128 people from Sydney to Hong Kong.
item.title: From the Archives, 1971: Two arrested over Qantas jet plot
